description: From (the stem of) Latin indigitāre (“call upon (a deity), proclaim”), of uncertain origin; later associated with digitus (“finger”).

verbs.description: indigitate (third-person singular simple present indigitates, present participle indigitating, simple past and past participle indigitated)

examples: Horace therefore, Juvenal, and Persius were no Prophets, although their lines did seem to indigitate and point at our times.
